member.summary: Logs off the current user, shuts down the system, or shuts down and restarts the system. It sends the WM_QUERYENDSESSION message to all applications to determine if they can be terminated.
member.param: Specifies the type of shutdown.
The reason for initiating the shutdown.
member.returns:
If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero.
If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call Marshal.GetLastWin32Error.

member.name: M:Vanara.Diagnostics.SystemShutdown.InitiateShutdown(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Vanara.PInvoke.SystemShutDownReason)
member.summary: Initiates a shutdown and optional restart of the specified computer.
member.param: String that specifies the network name of the computer to shut down. If NULL or an empty string, the function shuts down the local computer.
String that specifies a message to display in the shutdown dialog box. This parameter can be NULL if no message is required.
Time that the shutdown dialog box should be displayed, in seconds. While this dialog box is displayed, shutdown can be stopped by the AbortSystemShutdown function.
If this parameter is TRUE, applications with unsaved changes are to be forcibly closed. If this parameter is FALSE, the system displays a dialog box instructing the user to close the applications.
If this parameter is TRUE, the computer is to restart immediately after shutting down. If this parameter is FALSE, the system flushes all caches to disk and clears the screen.
Reason for initiating the shutdown. This parameter must be one of the system shutdown reason codes.
member.returns: 0 on failure, non-zero for success

member.name: M:Vanara.Diagnostics.SystemShutdown.InitiateShutdown(System.String,System.String,System.TimeSpan,Vanara.PInvoke.AdvApi32.ShutdownFlags,Vanara.PInvoke.SystemShutDownReason)
member.summary: Initiates a shutdown and restart of the specified computer, and restarts any applications that have been registered for restart.
member.param: The name of the computer to be shut down. If the value of this parameter is NULL, the local computer is shut down.
The message to be displayed in the interactive shutdown dialog box.

The number of seconds to wait before shutting down the computer. If the value of this parameter is zero, the computer is shut down immediately. This value is limited to MAX_SHUTDOWN_TIMEOUT.
If the value of this parameter is greater than zero, and the dwShutdownFlags parameter specifies the flag SHUTDOWN_GRACE_OVERRIDE, the function fails and returns the error code ERROR_BAD_ARGUMENTS.
One or more bit flags that specify options for the shutdown.

The reason for initiating the shutdown. This parameter must be one of the system shutdown reason codes. If this parameter is zero, the default is an undefined shutdown that is logged as "No title for this reason could be found". By default, it is also an unplanned shutdown. Depending on how the system is configured, an unplanned shutdown triggers the creation of a file that contains the system state information, which can delay shutdown. Therefore, do not use zero for this parameter.

member.summary: When set, this flag displays the Reset permissions on all child objects and enable propagation of inheritable permissions check box in the Permissions page of the Access Control Settings window. This function does not reset the permissions and enable propagation of inheritable permissions.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.AccessControlEditorDialog.AllowEditAudit
member.summary: If this flag is set and the user clicks the Advanced button, the system displays an advanced security property sheet that includes an Auditing property page for editing the object's SACL.

member.summary: If this flag is set and the user clicks the Advanced button, the system displays an advanced security property sheet that includes an Owner property page for changing the object's owner.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.AccessControlEditorDialog.AllowSaclInheritanceReset
member.summary: When set, this flag displays the Reset auditing entries on all child objects and enables propagation of the inheritable auditing entries check box in the Auditing page of the Access Control Settings window. This function does not reset the permissions and enable propagation of inheritable permissions.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.AccessControlEditorDialog.AuditElevationRequired
member.summary: When set, this flag displays a shield on the Edit button of the advanced Auditing pages.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.AccessControlEditorDialog.CustomPageTitle
member.summary: If this flag is set, the Title property value is used as the title of the basic security property page. Otherwise, a default title is used.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.AccessControlEditorDialog.DisallowInheritance
member.summary: If this flag is set, the access control editor hides the check box that controls the NO_PROPAGATE_INHERIT_ACE flag. This flag is relevant only when the Advanced flag is also set.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.AccessControlEditorDialog.DisallowProtectedAcls
member.summary: If this flag is set, the access control editor hides the check box that allows inheritable ACEs to propagate from the parent object to this object. If this flag is not set, the check box is visible. The check box is clear if the SE_DACL_PROTECTED flag is set in the object's security descriptor. In this case, the object's DACL is protected from being modified by inheritable ACEs. If the user clears the check box, any inherited ACEs in the security descriptor are deleted or converted to non-inherited ACEs. Before proceeding with this conversion, the system displays a warning message box to confirm the change.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.AccessControlEditorDialog.EditProperties
member.summary: If this flag is set, the system enables controls for editing ACEs that apply to the object's property sets and properties. These controls are available only on the property sheet displayed when the user clicks the Advanced button.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.AccessControlEditorDialog.ElevationRequired
member.summary: When set, this flag displays a shield on the Edit button of the simple and advanced Permissions pages.

member.summary: Sets the non-client rendering policy. The retrieved value is from the NonClientRenderingPolicy enumeration.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Forms.DesktopWindowManager.SetWindowAttr.TransitionsForceDisabled
member.summary: Enables or forcibly disables DWM transitions. The retrieved value is of type bool. True to disable transitions or False to enable transitions.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Forms.DesktopWindowManager.SetWindowAttr.AllowNonClientPaint
member.summary: Enables content rendered in the non-client area to be visible on the frame drawn by DWM. The retrieved value is of type bool. True to enable content rendered in the non-client area to be visible on the frame; otherwise, False.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Forms.DesktopWindowManager.SetWindowAttr.NonClientRtlLayout
member.summary: Sets whether non-client content is right-to-left (RTL) mirrored. The retrieved value is of type bool. True if the non-client content is right-to-left (RTL) mirrored; otherwise False.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Forms.DesktopWindowManager.SetWindowAttr.ForceIconicRepresentation
member.summary: Forces the window to display an iconic thumbnail or peek representation (a static bitmap), even if a live or snapshot representation of the window is available. This value normally is set during a window's creation and not changed throughout the window's lifetime. Some scenarios, however, might require the value to change over time. The retrieved value is of type bool. True to require a iconic thumbnail or peek representation; otherwise, False.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Forms.DesktopWindowManager.SetWindowAttr.Flip3DPolicy
member.summary: Sets how Flip3D treats the window. The pvAttribute parameter points to a value from the Flip3DWindowPolicy enumeration.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Forms.DesktopWindowManager.SetWindowAttr.HasIconicBitmap
member.summary: Win7+. Sets if the window will provide a bitmap for use by DWM as an iconic thumbnail or peek representation (a static bitmap) for the window. HasIconicBitmap can be specified with ForceIconicRepresentation. HasIconicBitmap normally is set during a window's creation and not changed throughout the window's lifetime. Some scenarios, however, might require the value to change over time. The retrieved value is of type bool. True to inform DWM that the window will provide an iconic thumbnail or peek representation; otherwise, False.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Forms.DesktopWindowManager.SetWindowAttr.DisallowPeek
member.summary: Win7+. Set true to not show peek preview for the window. The peek view shows a full-sized preview of the window when the mouse hovers over the window's thumbnail in the taskbar. If this attribute is set, hovering the mouse pointer over the window's thumbnail dismisses peek (in case another window in the group has a peek preview showing). The retrieved value is of type bool. True to prevent peek functionality or False to allow it.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Forms.DesktopWindowManager.SetWindowAttr.ExcludedFromPeek
member.summary: Win7+. Sets value preventing a window from fading to a glass sheet when peek is invoked. The retrieved value is of type bool. True to prevent the window from fading during another window's peek or False for normal behavior.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Forms.DesktopWindowManager.SetWindowAttr.Cloak
member.summary: Win8+. Cloaks the window such that it is not visible to the user. The window is still composed by DWM. True to cloak or False to not cloak.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Forms.DesktopWindowManager.SetWindowAttr.FreezeRepresentation
member.summary: Win8+. Freeze the window's thumbnail image with its current visuals. Do no further live updates on the thumbnail image to match the window's contents.

If this member is null and the ExpandedControlText is specified, then the ExpandedControlText value will be used for this member as well.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.CommonButtons
member.summary: Specifies the push buttons displayed in the dialog box. This parameter may be a combination of otherFlags. If no common buttons are specified and no custom buttons are specified using the Buttons member, the dialog box will contain the OK button by default.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.Content
member.summary: The string to be used for the dialog’s primary content. If the EnableHyperlinks member is true, then this string may contain hyper-links in the form: Hyper-link Text. WARNING: Enabling hyper-links when using content from an unsafe source may cause security vulnerabilities.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.CustomFooterIcon
member.summary: Specifies a custom icon for the icon to be displayed in the footer area of the dialog box. If this is set to none and the CustomFooterIcon member is null then no footer icon will be displayed.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.CustomMainIcon
member.summary: Specifies a custom in icon for the main icon in the dialog. If this is set to none and the CustomMainIcon member is null then no main icon will be displayed.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.DefaultButton
member.summary: Indicates the default button for the dialog. This may be any of the values specified in ButtonId members of one of the TaskDialogButton structures in the Buttons array, or one a DialogResult value that corresponds to a buttons specified in the CommonButtons Member. If this member is zero or its value does not correspond to any button ID in the dialog, then the first button in the dialog will be the default.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.DefaultRadioButton
member.summary: Indicates the default radio button for the dialog. This may be any of the values specified in ButtonId members of one of the TaskDialogButton structures in the RadioButtons array. If this member is zero or its value does not correspond to any radio button ID in the dialog, then the first button in RadioButtons will be the default. The property NoDefaultRadioButton can be set to have no default.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.EnableHyperlinks
member.summary: Enables hyper-link processing for the strings specified in the Content, ExpandedInformation and FooterText members. When enabled, these members may be strings that contain hyper-links in the form: Hyper-link Text. WARNING: Enabling hyper-links when using content from an unsafe source may cause security vulnerabilities. Note: Task Dialog will not actually execute any hyper-links. Hyper-link execution must be handled in the callback function specified by Callback member.

member.name: E:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.Expanded

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.ExpandedByDefault

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.ExpandedControlText
member.summary: The string to be used to label the button for collapsing the expanded information. This member is ignored when the ExpandedInformation member is null. If this member is null and the CollapsedControlText is specified, then the CollapsedControlText value will be used for this member as well.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.ExpandedInformation
member.summary: The string to be used for displaying additional information. The additional information is displayed either immediately below the content or below the footer text depending on whether the ExpandFooterArea member is true. If the EnameHyperlinks member is true, then this string may contain hyper-links in the form: Hyper-link Text. WARNING: Enabling hyper-links when using content from an unsafe source may cause security vulnerabilities.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.ExpandFooterArea
member.summary: Indicates that the string specified by the ExpandedInformation member should be displayed at the bottom of the dialog’s footer area instead of immediately after the dialog’s content. This flag is ignored if the ExpandedInformation member is null.

member.name: P:Vanara.Windows.Forms.TaskDialog.Footer

member.name: T:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution
member.summary: Flags determining how the links with missing targets are resolved.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.None
member.summary: No flags set.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.NoUI
member.summary: Do not display a dialog box if the link cannot be resolved. When NoUI is set, a time-out value that specifies the maximum amount of time to be spent resolving the link can be specified in milliseconds. The function returns if the link cannot be resolved within the time-out duration. If the timeout is not set, the time-out duration will be set to the default value of 3,000 milliseconds (3 seconds).

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.AnyMatch
member.summary: Allow any match during resolution. Has no effect on ME/2000 or above, use the other flags instead.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.Update
member.summary: If the link object has changed, update its path and list of identifiers. If UPDATE is set, you do not need to call IPersistFile::IsDirty to determine whether or not the link object has changed.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.NoUpdate
member.summary: Do not update the link information.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.NoSearch
member.summary: Do not execute the search heuristics.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.NoTrack
member.summary: Do not use distributed link tracking.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.NoLinkInfo
member.summary: Disable distributed link tracking. By default, distributed link tracking tracks removable media across multiple devices based on the volume name. It also uses the UNC path to track remote file systems whose drive letter has changed. Setting NoLinkInfo disables both types of tracking.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.InvokeMSI
member.summary: Call the Microsoft Windows Installer.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.NoUIWithMsgPump
member.summary: Windows XP and later. Assume same as NoUI but intended for applications without a hWnd.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.OfferDeleteWithoutFile
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Offer the option to delete the shortcut when this method is unable to resolve it, even if the shortcut is not a shortcut to a file.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.KnonnFolder
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Report as dirty if the target is a known folder and the known folder was redirected. This only works if the original target path was a file system path or ID list and not an aliased known folder ID list.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.MachineInLocalTarget
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Resolve the computer name in UNC targets that point to a local computer. This value is used with SLDFKEEPLOCALIDLISTFORUNCTARGET.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.LinkResolution.UpdateMachineAndSid

member.name: T:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute
member.summary: Attributes that can be retrieved on an item (file or folder) or set of items using .

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.CanCopy
member.summary: The specified items can be copied.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.CanMove
member.summary: The specified items can be moved.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.CanLink
member.summary: Shortcuts can be created for the specified items. If a namespace extension returns this attribute, a Create Shortcut entry with a default handler is added to the shortcut menu that is displayed during drag-and-drop operations. The extension can also implement its own handler for the link verb in place of the default. If the extension does so, it is responsible for creating the shortcut. A Create Shortcut item is also added to the Windows Explorer File menu and to normal shortcut menus. If the item is selected, your application's IContextMenu::InvokeCommand method is invoked with the lpVerb member of the CMINVOKECOMMANDINFO structure set to link. Your application is responsible for creating the link.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Storage
member.summary: The specified items can be bound to an IStorage object throughIShellFolder::BindToObject. For more information about namespace manipulation capabilities, see IStorage.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.CanRename
member.summary: The specified items can be renamed. Note that this value is essentially a suggestion; not all namespace clients allow items to be renamed. However, those that do must have this attribute set.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.CanDelete
member.summary: The specified items can be deleted.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.HasPropSheet
member.summary: The specified items have property sheets.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.DropTarget
member.summary: The specified items are drop targets.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.CapabilityMask
member.summary: This flag is a mask for the capability attributes: CANCOPY, CANMOVE, CANLINK, CANRENAME, CANDELETE, HASPROPSHEET, and DROPTARGET. Callers normally do not use this value.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.System
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The specified items are system items.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Encrypted
member.summary: The specified items are encrypted and might require special presentation.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.IsSlow
member.summary: Accessing the item (through IStream or other storage interfaces) is expected to be a slow operation. Applications should avoid accessing items flagged with ISSLOW. Note: Opening a stream for an item is generally a slow operation at all times. ISSLOW indicates that it is expected to be especially slow, for example in the case of slow network connections or offline (FILE_ATTRIBUTE_OFFLINE) files. However, querying ISSLOW is itself a slow operation. Applications should query ISSLOW only on a background thread. An alternate method, such as retrieving the PKEY_FileAttributes property and testing for FILE_ATTRIBUTE_OFFLINE, could be used in place of a method call that involves ISSLOW.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Ghosted
member.summary: The specified items are shown as dimmed and unavailable to the user.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Link
member.summary: The specified items are shortcuts.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Share
member.summary: The specified objects are shared.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.ReadOnly
member.summary: The specified items are read-only. In the case of folders, this means that new items cannot be created in those folders. This should not be confused with the behavior specified by the FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY flag retrieved by IColumnProvider::GetItemData in a SHCOLUMNDATAstructure. FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY has no meaning for Win32 file system folders.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Hidden
member.summary: The item is hidden and should not be displayed unless the Show hidden files and folders option is enabled in Folder Settings.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.DisplayAttrMask
member.summary: Do not use.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.NonEnumerated
member.summary: The items are nonenumerated items and should be hidden. They are not returned through an enumerator such as that created by theIShellFolder::EnumObjects method.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.NewContent
member.summary: The items contain new content, as defined by the particular application.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.CanMoniker
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.HasStorage
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Stream
member.summary: Indicates that the item has a stream associated with it. That stream can be accessed through a call to IShellFolder::BindToObject orIShellItem::BindToHandler with IID_IStream in the riid parameter.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.StorageAncestor
member.summary: Children of this item are accessible through IStream or IStorage. Those children are flagged with STORAGE or STREAM.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Validate
member.summary: When specified as input, VALIDATE instructs the folder to validate that the items contained in a folder or Shell item array exist. If one or more of those items do not exist, IShellFolder::GetAttributesOf and IShellItemArray::GetAttributes return a failure code. This flag is never returned as an [out] value. When used with the file system folder, VALIDATE instructs the folder to discard cached properties retrieved by clients of IShellFolder2::GetDetailsEx that might have accumulated for the specified items.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Removable
member.summary: The specified items are on removable media or are themselves removable devices.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Compressed
member.summary: The specified items are compressed.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Browsable
member.summary: The specified items can be hosted inside a web browser or Windows Explorer frame.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.FileSysAncestor
member.summary: The specified folders are either file system folders or contain at least one descendant (child, grandchild, or later) that is a file system (FILESYSTEM) folder.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.Folder
member.summary: The specified items are folders. Some items can be flagged with both STREAM and FOLDER, such as a compressed file with a .zip file name extension. Some applications might include this flag when testing for items that are both files and containers.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.FileSystem
member.summary: The specified folders or files are part of the file system (that is, they are files, directories, or root directories). The parsed names of the items can be assumed to be valid Win32 file system paths. These paths can be either UNC or drive-letter based.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.StorageCapMask
member.summary: This flag is a mask for the storage capability attributes: STORAGE, LINK, READONLY, STREAM, STORAGEANCESTOR, FILESYSANCESTOR, FOLDER, and FILESYSTEM. Callers normally do not use this value.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.HasSubfolder
member.summary: The specified folders have subfolders. The HASSUBFOLDER attribute is only advisory and might be returned by Shell folder implementations even if they do not contain subfolders. Note, however, that the converse—failing to return HASSUBFOLDER—definitively states that the folder objects do not have subfolders. Returning HASSUBFOLDER is recommended whenever a significant amount of time is required to determine whether any subfolders exist. For example, the Shell always returns HASSUBFOLDER when a folder is located on a network drive.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.ContentsMask
member.summary: This flag is a mask for content attributes, at present only HASSUBFOLDER. Callers normally do not use this value.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemAttribute.PKEYMask
member.summary: Mask used by the PKEY_SFGAOFlags property to determine attributes that are considered to cause slow calculations or lack context: ISSLOW, READONLY, HASSUBFOLDER, and VALIDATE. Callers normally do not use this value.

member.name: T:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemDisplayString
member.summary: Requests the form of an item's display name to retrieve through .

member.summary: Returns the display name relative to the parent folder. In UI this name is generally ideal for display to the user.

member.summary: Returns the parsing name relative to the parent folder. This name is not suitable for use in UI.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemDisplayString.DesktopAbsoluteParsing
member.summary: Returns the parsing name relative to the desktop. This name is not suitable for use in UI.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemDisplayString.ParentRelativeEditing
member.summary: Returns the editing name relative to the parent folder. In UI this name is suitable for display to the user.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemDisplayString.DesktopAbsoluteEditing
member.summary: Returns the editing name relative to the desktop. In UI this name is suitable for display to the user.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemDisplayString.FileSysPath
member.summary: Returns the item's file system path, if it has one. Only items that report SFGAO_FILESYSTEM have a file system path. When an item does not have a file system path, a call to IShellItem::GetDisplayName on that item will fail. In UI this name is suitable for display to the user in some cases, but note that it might not be specified for all items.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemDisplayString.Url
member.summary: Returns the item's URL, if it has one. Some items do not have a URL, and in those cases a call to IShellItem::GetDisplayName will fail. This name is suitable for display to the user in some cases, but note that it might not be specified for all items.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemDisplayString.ParentRelativeForAddressBar
member.summary: Returns the path relative to the parent folder in a friendly format as displayed in an address bar. This name is suitable for display to the user.

member.name: F:Vanara.Windows.Shell.ShellItemDisplayString.ParentRelative
member.summary: Returns the path relative to the parent folder.
